title: Website font
content:
Hi all,

Just wondering which font does this site uses for it’s main text:

[http://productionsmicro-fun.com/forfaits.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907052907/http:/productionsmicro-fun.com/forfaits.htm "http://productionsmicro-fun.com/forfaits.htm")

Thanks

 [‹ Salamanca](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907052907/http:/typophile.com/node/37972 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Smallville and Superman returns opening credits - Gotham, Steile Futura {Patricia, Lex} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907052907/http:/typophile.com/node/38052 "Go to next forum topic")
author: slave1

comments.content:
In the [CSS](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907052907/http:/productionsmicro-fun.com/styleb.css) they specified  
<cite>font-family: Georgia, “Times New Roman”, Times, serif;</cite>  
for some parts and  
<cite>font-family: Verdana;</cite> and <cite>font-family: “Arial Black”;</cite>  
for others.  
Additionally, there is <cite>font face=”Tahoma”</cite> in the page’s HTML.

Still, that doesn’t tell me what **you** are seeing; a sample would help. I for one see a lot of Verdana and some Helvetica, having not installed Tahoma and Arial Black.

I guess we see the same thing, damn I should’ve thought about looking into the page source :)

Thanks Florian
